byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

abstract: Death of Marine Staff Sgt Louis F Cardin in Iraq, and subsequent admissions by American military, reveal how operations there have quietly expanded despite pledge from Pres Obama to keep troops out of combat; Cardin and his comrades were part of secret posting at fire base in northern Iraq, where they where charged with protecting Iraqi security forces and American advisers.
lead_paragraph: New information from U.S. military officials after the death of Staff Sgt. Louis F. Cardin also raised questions about President Obama’s pledge to keep troops out of combat there.

headline.main: Marine’s Death in a Secret Iraqi Base Reflects a Quietly Expanding U.S. Role
headline.print_headline: New Focus on U.S. Role in Iraq

snippet: New information from U.S. military officials after the death of Staff Sgt. Louis F. Cardin also raised questions about President Obama’s pledge to keep troops out of combat there.
